Description: Fragment of ring foot and bowl of Attic black-glazed pottery bowl; interior glazed with stamped decoration consisting, from outside, of five palmettes attached to band of tongues, and four palmettes around two central rings; exterior: reserved junction of wall and foot; stand-ring reserved; on underside, broad band near outside, dot and rings near centre; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1818)
